description.summary: A fictional supernatural entity created in 2009 by Eric Knudsen for a Something Awful forum contest. Tall, thin, featureless face, black suit, tentacle-like appendages. Evolved from collaborative fiction to belief in some individuals.
description.full: Slenderman is a fictional supernatural entity created on June 10, 2009, by Eric Knudsen (username Victor Surge) for a Something Awful forum 'create paranormal images' contest. Depicted as an unnaturally tall, thin figure with a featureless white face, wearing a black suit, with tentacle-like appendages extending from its back. The character stalks, abducts, and traumatizes victims (especially children), causes 'Slender sickness' (paranoia, nightmares), and can teleport. Originally collaborative internet fiction (creepypasta), Slenderman went viral through web series like Marble Hornets, video games (Slender: The Eight Pages), and widespread sharing. The phenomenon took a tragic turn in 2014 when two 12-year-old girls in Wisconsin stabbed a classmate 19 times, claiming they did it to please Slenderman. This incident highlighted the potential for fiction-to-belief transformation. Slenderman represents modern mythology creation: a documented fictional entity that became embedded in cultural consciousness, with some individuals (especially youth) developing genuine belief. Related to other internet folklore like The Rake and Black-eyed Children.

Causes paranoia, nightmares, nosebleeds, and psychological distress in victims
Follows and observes victims over extended periods
Abducts victims, especially children, with no trace

origins.creation_context: Eric Knudsen created Slenderman for a Something Awful forum contest asking users to create paranormal images by editing ordinary photographs. He posted two black-and-white images of groups of children with a tall, faceless figure in the background, along with fabricated witness testimonies.

timeline.significance: Eric Knudsen posts first Slenderman images and story on Something Awful
Other users contribute stories, images, and lore
YouTube web series popularizes Slenderman, presents as found footage
Free horror game goes viral, introduces millions to Slenderman
Two 12-year-old girls stab classmate 19 times to 'please Slenderman'; victim survives
HBO documentary 'Beware the Slenderman'; feature film 'Slender Man'

original_posts.creator: Victor Surge (Eric Knudsen)
original_posts.content: Posted two edited photographs with accompanying text suggesting a mysterious entity that stalks and abducts children
original_posts.significance: Documented creation of modern mythology in real-time

wisconsin_stabbing.perpetrators: Two 12-year-old girls (Morgan Geyser and Anissa Weier)
wisconsin_stabbing.details: The two girls lured their friend into woods and stabbed her 19 times, claiming they did it to become 'proxies' of Slenderman and prove his existence
wisconsin_stabbing.outcome: Victim survived; perpetrators convicted and committed to mental health facilities
wisconsin_stabbing.significance: Demonstrated real-world harm from fiction-to-belief transformation; raised questions about internet influence on children

other_incidents.description: Ohio woman attacked her mother while wearing white mask, claiming Slenderman made her do it
Florida teen set house on fire, claimed Slenderman ordered it
